title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Australian Rugby League Commission chairman Peter Beattie says he has “an enormous amount of sympathy for Canberra fans, but the reality is, the decision was right”. The Sydney Roosters claimed their second straight premiership, defeating the Canberra Raiders 14-8 in a controversial NRL Grand Final. Mr Beattie told Sky News “It was always going to be a close competition and the fans certainly got their money’s worth with almost 83,000 of them there”. The match was full of contentious refereeing decisions, including a controversial six-again call. “We shouldn’t forget the fact that the Roosters have done a magnificent job winning back-to-back,” he said. Image: News Corp Australia
